intro: Stephania japonica var. elegans, commonly known as Japanese stephania, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically followed by kidney-shaped berries. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
